result.markdown: --- format : html title: "Simmer Guide" --- ::: {.cell} ::: ## Simmer With `simmer`, you can use block programming to simulate probability experiments, among other things. This guide assumes you have some CODAP skills: - You can make graphs. - You can make a new attribute (a new column) and give it a simple formula. Do the three lessons you can see in the sidebar. ### Simmer in a new tab If you want to experiment outside of this guide, click the link below to open a `simmer` document in a new tab. You'll have more space. Bookmark it so you can `simmer` again whenever you want.  a fresh simmer document
